doc.previous: Later, during a Mass, Pope John Paul II criticised the regime for impoverishing the peasants and the unemployed, claiming that the government must give people greater access to the land. Although Stroessner tried to prevent him from doing so, Pope John Paul II met opposition leaders in the one-party state.[145]
doc.after: John PaulÂ II has been credited with being instrumental in bringing down Communism in Central and Eastern Europe,[65][73][78][94][95][146] by being the spiritual inspiration behind its downfall and catalyst for "a peaceful revolution" in Poland. In Warsaw, in 1979, he simply said: 'Do not be afraid', and later prayed: 'Let your Spirit descend and change the image of the land ... this land'."[146] It has also been widely alleged that the Vatican Bank covertly funded Solidarity.[147][148]
